Initially, he felt like heading to another hotdog establishment that was just a walk away from the toddler's class...but rarely does the idea of eating hotdogs for lunch is a thought in this family. If we are gonna go in might as well go all out...cheat day has arrived!

We enter around 130 and I was glad to see it empty with the exception of 1 other customer who we followed in. I kinda knew what I wanted to try, and it was a matter of rushing the husband to get his life together so we can order. He was too busy staring at the hangover soup. No, stop staring at the soup...you aren't hungover...and we came for weiners..so pick which weiner you are going to shove into your mouth! Pastrami? Finally. Okay, so husband opts for pastrami as he still stares at the hangover soup. Which btw, the pastrami isn't listed on their online menu for reference so I don't exactly know what was in his aside from the weiner, tomatoes, and thin cuts of pastrami. 

I ordered whatever righteous banh mi lover would...the banh mi. It had the weiner, slices of carrots and radish that you'd find in an actual banh mi, crispy pork belly atop, and some herb seasoning along the bun, and parsley lightly sprinkled on to it. 

Unfortunately, looks deceived. I didn't get that banh mi hotdog experience i was expecting. Perhaps I was too literal, but flavor wise was very underwhelming to me. The pickling of the carrots and radish was not evident. I felt the sriracha mayo should have been squirted on there a little more heavily. All my tastebuds picked up was the hot dog, crispy pork belly, and what heat I got from the sriracha. I was really hoping to get that banh mi flavor plus hotdog! And i didnt. So at $7.25 I felt a tad bummed because while I thought it wasn't bad, it just fell short. 

My husband thought the same thing. He ate it with no comment so I knew he wasn't mind blown. Later he commented that if the hotdog was around the 5 dollar range the he would have felt different. But at 7.25 and you dont get any perk like a drink or fries with it...he wasnt thrilled. I'd probably come back for the euro fries as raved on other reviews or to try something different. I know for sure I wouldn't take my children here because they don't appreciate hotdogs like that and that'll become a steep bill with drinks and side orders to consider. They're gonna have to explore fusion hotdogs on their own time later in life. Gotta let them have something left to explore on this planet. Lol.

Customer service was very friendly and prompt, restaurant was clean, menu boards everywhere so there's no way you won't be able to find it, seat yourself, and coke vending... =)

Recommend giving them a try for sure! Kid and stroller friendly. A couple tables outside for outdoor seating. 

Enjoy!

Whenever I'm in the mood for hot dogs, this is the place. Recently, I've tried their Chicago dog, Carne Asada dog, and chili cheese fries. Their menu has a large variety of options, and honestly, everything sounds very good. The service is not bad, but at times could be slow. One hot dog is very filling, and with a side of regular or, even better, chili cheese fries, it could be a little difficult to finish it all. When you come here for a hot dog, keep in mind that it's definitely not the most healthy food choice. And tbh, upon finishing the meal, you probably won't feel like you just ate the best thing for you. But I don't eat hot dogs too often, and I really come here for my hot dog cravings. The food tastes very good and everything is freshly made. Therefore, it's my go-to hot dog place in town.

I'm kind of addicted to hot dogs, and Buldogis just opened right next to my favorite neighborhood bar (Chicago Brewery).  Can it get any better?  Well, yeah.  The hot dogs are actually really good, and the prices are very reasonable.  
The menu has a ton of options, focusing mainly on Korean style dogs, and classic dogs (all priced just under $5).  You can even create your own.  The toppings include pulled pork, sauerkraut, bulgogi, pork belly, shredded cheese, and many more.  Tons of sauce choices too  (there were almost 10 different mayo flavors to choose from).  There are also salads, wraps, wings, a corn dog, a vegan dog, and fries.  
The classic fries were delicious, and a great portion for $2.  We tried the angry kimchi fries as well, and those were just crazy.  A whole box of fries topped with shredded cheese, pork bulgogi, kimchi, and a fried egg ($5).  Delicious, and very indulgent.

So me and my friend went to this place and gave it the ultimate test, what we did was, we got six hot dogs what we thought were the best and we ate half of each with kimchi fries. The fries were darn good and the dogs were great too. We both really liked the carne asada dog , dragon dog and the angry dog. But toward the end it all started tasting the same perhaps it was just too much. But another reason might be even thought the topics on the dogs were different, the dogs were mostly the same so that might be why they kinda did taste the same.  Don't get me wrong all the dogs were pretty good, just don't try too many at ones lol.

3.5 stars

My wife and I aren't hot dog fans. They're usually the last on our list of fast food choices but we couldn't resist checking this place out for food creativity sake. 

We got a chili cheese dog, a bulgogi dog using the vegetarian dog and the angry kimchi fries. My order of the bulgogi with vegetarian wiener seemed to perplex them so they let me know bulgogi was beef. I just didn't feel like having certain cow parts that evening :) 

Both dogs were really tasty. The bun wasn't a run of the mill and bought at Costco bun which made it feel more gourmet. I loved the flavor of the angry kimchi fries but I would've preferred regular potato over sweet. 

The staff and owner were really nice. They had made an extra bread pudding by mistake and gave it to us for free. The owner told us they make their pudding out of the 2 day old buns they buy direct from a local bakery in town. We had never tried it before since bread pudding always seemed like a way too heavy over the top kind of dessert in restaurants (bread before the entree....and after??) but liked the sweet caramel flavor of this pretty dense "cake".

Bottom line is if you love hot dogs, you will love this place.

These hot dogs are crazy and good.

My boyfriend and I try different items every time we come here and are never disappointed with what we get.  We came to realize that before we're even done eating we are checking out the menu to figure out what we'll try the next time!

They have a little bit of everything and don't forget there's another menu on the wall behind you when you're ordering.

Yum.  I go past this place every day for 2 + year and never stopped in.  However, tonight was different. Maybe the reddish tint to the moon or the coolish evening air but something made me go.  Glad I did!  The hot dog was crisp and flavorful and topping it with pork belly and garlic mayo was inspired.  The fries were also good and surprisingly crisp even though they too had pork belly bacon and mayo on top.

The bun was soft but not soggy or stale.

Staff was friendly, price is right, and my belly is happy.

This place is a fantastic find!  If you've lived elsewhere besides Vegas where people have a more diverse flavor for their food, this place will rock your boat!  Toppings such as garlic aioli, pork belly and sriracha chili sauce hit the spot just right.  An added bonus...everything costs $5 or less!

The can't misses:
Euro fries with a fried egg on top
Bahn mi dog

Getting the next go around:
Angry Kimchi Fries!

The service is the icing on the cake.  People who love what they do and love their customers even more!  I would eat here everyday if I didn't end up weighing 300 lbs.  So I will just settle for once a week!

Had the banh mi buldogi and carne aside fries. Both were excellent, the ingredients were fresh and I like how everything is made in front of you right after you order. I got in 5 minutes before closing and Jesus was still super nice about letting me dine in that night (I was a server before and I know how annoying it can be). But the service was excellent and the food was good and fairly priced! Definitely recommend this place. Only negative thing is that they close kind of early

Best hot dogs ever!  I got the angry dog and my husband got the southern dog.  We also got the carne Asada fries and fried pickles.  Pretty much the best thing ever.  Don't think about it, just do it.

Oh geez - after looking at all the pics for this place I practically had a food boner!  I drove over there ready to be amazed.  

It is a small mom and pop joint with an easy going atmosphere.  The menu was unique and I was intrigued.  The food was fresh, cheap and plentiful.  There really is no reason not to like this place.

Sorry to reprot: I was disappointed in the food.  We ordered a Bahn Mi & a Buckeye hot dog plus an order of fries.  

I wanted to love this place but this is one bandwagon I simply cannot get with.  Basically, you get a hot dog topped with a garrish array of competing ingredients.  The food didn't go together.  The toppings and the dog were not in harmony.  It is kinda like when the Houston Rockets teamed Olajuwon with Drexler and then added Barkly.  Three great players but they just didn't seem to go together. 

The Buckeye dog - pork belly, corn, cheese and mayo-  just didn't work.
The Bahn Mi - Pork belly, slaw, siracha mayo- just didn't work.

The fries were just normal too.  They were supposed to have parm cheese but I tasted nothing.  Maybe a sprinkle of some spice mixture and that's it.

I didn't even finish the hot dogs or the fries.  This place has great reviews - so by all means check it out.  This is just one guy's opinion.  I guess I just like my dogs with some kraut and mustard...
First visit but we'll be back. Had the bulgogi and chili cheese fries. Both were terrific, great flavor and large portions. Staff were very friendly and helpful and the place.

Ate here for the first time yesterday. And it was AMAZING! I had the hawaiian style burger. And Kim chi fries. Both were mind blowing. Price for burgers and fries were reasonable.  But just for plain hotdogs for my 2 kids were 3.95 each . Which is a bit much for just plain hotdogs that's the only reason I ranked it a 4 star. But taste, customer service and atmosphere were all great

The Euro Special fries were awesome! Perfect crispy fries with a good balance of garnish. I'm not a fan of fries drowning in chili cheese sauce so this was just perfect! Got the Banh Mi Dog and loved the crunchy pickled vegetables on it. Hubby got the Bulgogi Burger, he seems really happy with it. *Burp*

Omg- absolutely the best hot dogs everrr!! Highly recommended!! They use fresh ingredients and you can tell. Great customer service. The chef was very friendly and offered us two diff dipping sauces for us to try out- soo good!!

This place lived up to the hype. I've had it booked marked for ages but never got around to coming out. Partially because I always feel the compulsive need to "earn" my treat meals and after a long hike at red rock a hotdog was well earned.

I got the angry dog because of the yelp reviews and my husband got the Hawaiian and we split a carne Asada fry. 

Everything was delicious, perfectly spicy and dripping in sauce.

Wanted to believe the hype and try this place out. I cook for a living and went in there expecting for "Korean" flavors to pop out in these dogs but it failed. The food has quality, even thoough the pick de gallo in our Asada fries seemed a bit old. But both me and my girl asked our selves the same question "where is the Korean flavor?" The bulgogi can use marinade for sure. Maybe next time Buldogi.

Really really enjoyed this place and wouldn't mind coming back here on my next Vegas visit. I really wish that the bay had a good hotdog joint like this place. Or maybe I just don't know about the hotdog places here in San Jose. Well maybe I don't know about the places here because it isn't all that great.....

Anyways, this place has some pretty good fused hotdogs. I ordered the beef bulgogi hotdog which was pretty much what it sounds; beef bulgogi, asian slaw, grilled onions, sesame seeds, and bulgogi mayo; I also added some cold kimchi to add a kick to my dog. My hotdog turned out yummy as hell, also it was pretty damn fulfilling. I also had a bite of my sisters hot dog, the dog of the week (dragon dog, with dragon sauce) that hotdog was one of the besterestest I've ever had, their dragon sauce was banging. I will definitely come back here for more and most likely try something different.

This place is pretty good. I had the Hawaiian dog on turkey and my bf had the angry dog on beef.I also ordered the jalapeno beer battered pickle spears that were on special were a fail. They were frozen and no jalapeno that i could find, the pickle fell right out of the batter burning your face.The dogs themselves were great the Turkey frank was big and juicy and they don't skimp on  the toppings.  loaded fries were very good too. The fries were also frozen fries but the toppings made up for them. The service is very friendly and we will defiantly be back ordering less food because we ordered way to much the first time around.About $24 for two dogs fries pickles and a drink.

Got the Angry hotdog, was good and spicy. Loved the Korean flavors. Left me wanting a good ole fashioned Chicago dog. Gonna try something else next time, maybe the fries. Definitely recommend trying this place out!

Talk about unique and fun, this place is so fun and relaxing. I love hot dogs and they turn up the usual boring hot dog into a hot dog 10x power with a little Korean flare. I had the buckeye which is made with a delicious garlic aioli sauce, caramelized onions, BACON, and cheddar and omg! Out of bounds. I'm definitely coming back here.

This place has a creative hot dog menu but the hot dogs are salty and the buns cheap.  I like the Chicago dog, chili dog and the creative asian fusion dogs, but I don't think this hot dog place is the best in town.  Service is good and the place is clean and fun.  Better than Wienerschnitzel but not quite Chicago Hot Dogs or Pinks.

My friend and I stopped in here for a bite before our movie.  We were greeted right away by the friendly staff.  They let me taste some of the sauces before making my order so I could make my decision.   My friend had the Angry dog and I had the Hawaiian, we both shared a small order of fries.  I absolutely loved my Hawaiian dog with the pineapples, and everything.  My friend said his Angry dog was definitely angry but good as well.  

There were a couple other dogs I wanted to try, but I guess I'll just have to come back and try them later!

Disgusting!  I had the chilli cheese fries and Buckeye Dog for lunch and spent the rest of the day wanting to vomit.  They covered the dog with a garlic mayo that smelled and tasted like  a nail salon.  The bun was dry and broke apart, the dog nothing special.  The pork belly was barely warm and under cooked.... overall I will never go again.  Hint: go to Costco, buy a couple dogs from the food counter, take them home and add your toppings to your liking. Cheaper and far far better!

If Korea and America got together and had a lovechild they would name it Buldogis.  
This is my fourth time eating here and I really love their food.  Went today 11-11-15 to get take-out.  
This restaurant is located on Fort Apache and Sahara across from Chicago Brewing Company.  
$41.51 got me some euro fries, bulgogi fries, a bulgogi dog, a chicago dog, a regular dog with cheese & bacon, and a small order of fries. 
The euro fries were so tasty...the yellow stuff on the top tastes like the top of the cheap garlic bread you can find in the freezer section in Walmart.  
I got nothing unique to say that the other 500+ people haven't mentioned...just come try this place!

This has to be the greatest hot dog/hamburger place I have ever had the pleasure to dine in! 

The staff here is always incredibly nice and helpful. The food will most definitely keep you satisfied until your next meal and everything I have eaten there so far is fantastic. The place is always nice and clean and small enough to feel cozy.

I'm a big fan of the Hawaiian burger but honestly I do not think you could go wrong with anything on their menu.

Finally made it by try out this place after hearing about it from a friend and on Yelp. I had the banh mi dog, hubs had the buckeye dog and baby had the puppy dog with ketchup - and we shared the classic fries. As a lover of all thing hot dog, this place did not disappoint. I'm usually a chili dog or ketchup and onions gal, so having the banh mi dog with pork belly, slaw and sriracha mayo was a bit of a leap for me, but it was soooo good. The hotdogs themselves are delicious, and the unusual concoctions just work. I tried a bit of the buckeye dog too and it was just as good. This is the kind of place where you're already planning your next trip before you leave. In fact, I would probably have lunch there today if I wasn't across town. I can't wait to go back and try something else.
Amazing, awesome, Fantastic and a word I don't usually throw out there, actually like 3 times in my life, PHENOMENAL !!!

I've only been here once, but the Hawaiian dog has got me hooked. I'm tempted to go back and get just that dog again, but I really should be trying their other stuff.

My friend told me it's really hard to finish the kimchi fries (or something of the sort) because there's just too much.

I'll most likely be looking to try some of their small items and see how it goes, but we'll see.
Why did I wait so long to go here!   Best hotdog I have ever had.  They also have wings and quesadillas.  This is a must try.  Bring your appetite!

I tried the Bahn Mi and Bulgogi hotdogs. The bulgogi was very tasty. The bahn mi was pretty good too, although if I didn't know, wouldn't have guessed it was supposed to be bahn mi inspired. We also got the euro fries. The toppings and sauce were great although were quickly gone on top and left behind a fair amount of fries underneath with no euro flavorings.  Im glad I tried them but they seemed a bit expensive for not having full flavoring of all the fries in the euro taste. 
Would gladly go again to try the other flavors, but maybe will skip the fires next time.

If you are looking for something different and like hot dogs, give them a try.  For the most part, it is korean, hot dog fusion, though there are some dogs on the menu that are not Korean.  It was tempting to order a couple dogs, but I'm glad I got just one, as it was huge.

Went by for lunch again, tried the Buldogis Chicago Dog with kimchi add-on.  In retrospect probably not the best combo, but kimchi is fresh and good, and they give you ample amounts.  The combo of the dog, kimchi, pickled peppers, catchup & mustard make it much too salty, however.  I think the bulgogi or spicy pork with the addition of kimchi will be the real winners.  Still, this is good stuff.

I love this place and I don't check in nearly as much as I frequent here. I love the toppings. I tend to eat the veggie dog and they allow you to customize it. Try it the "smoked dog" way-deeelish! They have a great menu and great employees

I discovered this place in the Las Vegas Weekly about a year or so ago. I had high expectations and I gotta say they exceeded it. There was another hotdogs place in town but I seem to always come back to this one. Just can't have enough.

extremely juicy, plump and yummy hotdogs, fantastic toppings and angry kimchi fries left me and my boy friend very happy....it felt like heaven to me and my stomach:) we ordered two hot dogs, one angry kimchi fries and one burger - yes, we couldn't choose, so we just ordered all. lol. The burger patty was somewhat dry and tough though. I will definitely revisit next time I am in Vegas, and I would just order any of the hotdogs and angry kimchi fries. nomnomnom!!
Had a chill cheese dog with onions and fries.. the best in town.. recommend this spot

This is right in my hood but to be honest the signage almost faces Ft. Apache but mostly pointing north with the storefront.  I come from the south so I rarely see the sign and finally made a point to pull in Saturday afternoon as a pre-movie snack.

Props to everyone working there for being super friendly.  Almost too friendly.  Since it was dogs, I sort of anticipated a chi-town or zoo-york 'tude but not so Joe.  They have a big chalk menu on the back wall but as you face the cute girl and the register there is a menu behind her.  Too much visual overload so I just ask for what is popular.  At 3pm, there are about 6 patrons eating in-house and I take that as a good sign for an off-time.

Based on the recommendation I opted for their Philly Cheese Steak hotdog, "sweet fries" and a Mt. Dew.  If you gonna do it, dew it!  Never had sweet fries or whatever they were called but I will probably just opt for chips next time.

Quickly I was served at my table with a great looking work of art hotdog. Certainly photo worthing and to quote a Seinfeldism...sponge worthy...whatever the hell that means.  I wolfed down the dog and was on my way.  Where I was sitting I did not see a garbage can so asked if I was to buss my own table.  No, we will they said but as I walked out I saw the garbage can and realized they just did me one.  Cool peeps.  I would highly recommend.

The food is bland. There is nothing bout this place that would make me want to come back. The service is crap and the cashier tried to convince me that they didn't remodel a few months ago. I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone. Unless u want to spend your money on mediocre food.

I really appreciate the concept and the flavors offered but I can't give it the raving 5 star review that everyone else seems to be giving. 

Was it bad?   No.   Was it so good it knocked my socks off?  No.  

The service was good and everyone seemed very nice.   Our order taker was new so there were a few hiccups but I'm not going to fault him for being new.   He was so courteous and friendly. 

The food was ok.   Maybe I was expecting deeper richer flavors?   The bulgogi didn't seem seasoned enough and the garlic aioli didn't taste nice.  But the hot dog itself was absolutely delicious. 

The angry burrito was also a little lacking in spice and flavor.

I'm going to definitely try this place again and order different items because maybe it just wasn't my day. 

We'll see....

This place has great variety of asian flavors on hot dogs as well as other mixed varieties. Food was great and portions are huge! You can share fries! Especially if you get the garlic fries! It is massive. You will definitely need a mint afterward.

came here due the high yelp review when I gambling in Red Rock. 

Food, meh, overrated. their hangover noodle soup is way too salty and the chicken meat in the noodle taste like from last night. another two hot dogs were only average but i paid almost 7 dollars each. overall food taste is below average to me. wont come back again. 

Restaurant was empty when we were there. people are friendly that's why its two star not one!

This place is right across the street from my house and I've always been skeptical about coming here, I'm glad Archie's was closed so I can give this place a shot for once. So glad I did. I just didn't know how good you can make a hotdog but I take it all back. These guys have something special going on. Thanks for the full belly.

This place is serving food way way above its price point.

I was expecting a hotdog with some some fancy toppings. Not only were the toppings top notch, they made an effort on the presentation. If this were at a casino on the Strip, it would have $15-$20. Instead I paid $7.50.

This place sets the standard for what a hotdog can be.
Carne Asada fries were from God and the smoked hot dog was delicious. Hot dog tasted all beef and was the best I've had in awhile.

Been here once before.  Swore next time I went I would try something other than the southern. Yeah didn't happen. And the dog was even better this time than last time. As if that's possible. The staff is so friendly   And don't forget to try the soy glazed wings. Really good quality gourmet fun fast food with tremendous flavor and taste!

I don't normally like hot dogs, but I loved this one! I got the beef bulgogi dog- not only was the beef on top tasty, but the hot dog itself was also very high quality. I also got the angry kimchi fries which were maybe even more delicious than the hot dog.  Sweet potato fries + kimchi + pork bulgogi = AMAZING! I will definitely be going back again- totally worth the 30 minute drive!

So good! You walk in and you immediately feel the energy of this restaurant. The decor and the staff really make this place very welcoming. I'm from out of town and this was close to where I was staying but now I really want to go out of my way to eat here again.

I ordered the Gangnam dog and the Angry fries. It was absolutely amazing. The marinated pork belly and the cucumbers in the Gangnam dog really make it what it really is. The angry sweet potato fries are topped with housemade kimchi, spicy pork belly, and other fixings. 

I would definitely come back to try the other dogs for sure. Everything is seasoned so well with what I ordered so I'm curious to the other menu items.

Keep up the awesome food Buldogis!

Was surprised/impressed when I found out the owner is not Korean. I don't even know how to make kimchi! lol Anyways had a nice little chat with him while we waited for the food. My boyfriend had the Bulgogi Burger which was really big and juicy lol...Got my mom the Angry Dog which had spicy pork bulgogi, asian slaw, diced jalapeno, and fiery mayo. Nice & spicy just the way she likes it. I took a star off because I ordered the Bahn Mi Dog but got the Buckeye Dog instead. It was okay but I was really looking forward to trying the Bahn Mi Dog. Will be back when I visit :)

I had the angry dog and the western dog. Forget the other stuff and just order the angry dog because it is soooooooo goooood.

Looooved the euro fries

Amazing food and friendly service!! I would definitely recommend the Bulgogi Dog and Euro Fries. The West Coast Dog was delicious too!! Worth every dollar spent and you also get a Yelp discount for checking in!! Check this place out...you won't be disappointed!

You want something different, here ya go.

Husband begged me to go here. Fusion hot dogs?! No thanks. But I humored him. 

Thank goodness I did! He loved his hot dogs (just not my thing) and I inhaled my carne asada fries! Amazing!!!!!!!

We come back often, when we want a different, relaxed date night.

Came here with my girl.  She got the bahn mi dog and I got the angry dog.  Both were amazing!  I recommend stopping in at least once especially if you like spicy stuff.  Also the bulgogi on the fries was killer as well :)

Tried a few things here. Had the Angry dog and Banh Mi dog. Both were good but at the end of the day hot dogs. The carne asada fries on the other hand, were amazing!

Would go back just to try the variety of things they have.
The food is really good here. I always get the angry dog and carne asada fries. This time I'm trying the chili cheese dog.
This place was good.  I gotta come back to try something different.  But it's too damn far.
Oh man I was totally not into trying this place at first (blame pregnancy) but once I took my first bite of the Hawaiian dog it was love. Really good hot dog. Give it a try.
Great staff. Soggy hotdog. Unique menu. Soggy wings. I guess, great price but a little disappointed from all the reviews.

I am a big fan of this place, especially as a post drinking meal. As a vegetarian, there are plenty of hearty no meat options to choose from, which was much appreciated for a hot dog place. There were a couple of items that piqued my interest: the vegetarian dog (with mac n cheese), Euro special fries (without the pork belly), mac n cheese quesadilla, and the vegetarian burrito. I ended up getting the burrito, and it was sooo delicious! They've marinated some meat replacement with bbq marinade and it completely provides you with that meat tasting fix. Definitely a heavy type of meal. Will definitely be going back again!

The great American hot dog with a amazing twist! What a delicious little gem. I had the chili cheese dog and it was delicious. I also ordered sweet potato fries. No belly issue after this place. It was fast, hot and fresh. Lunch today was great! Kimchi dog was also good. First try for me. 
5 stars will return

Glancing through an article on MSN about the best fries in each state, I saw that this place was touted the best for Nevada. We decided to check it out after looking at their website. OMG!!!!!! We ordered the Chicago,Bahn mi,Buckeye and Bulgogi dogs. Mickayla took our order and recommended that the dogs be cut in half and served in to go boxes, which made sense for us.  We also ordered the Euro Fries and the Carne Asada Fries. Mickayla brought our food outside to us and we checked out all of the food. As you can see by the pics it all looked amazing. Lori tried the Bahn Mi which has pork belly onions and a Sriracha mayo. She couldn't stop raving about it.  I tried the Bulgogi, I can't describe how good it was. The Carne Asada Fries were awesome, I can't believe that I have never been here before. We will definitely be back.  The service was great. If Mickayla is working, she will be glad to help you in your decision of what to have. While we were eating outside one of the cooks walked out and he suggested that we take the fries and make skillet breakfast by chopping up the leftover fries and add eggs. I'm already looking forward to breakfast tomorrow.  This place is one of those small hole in the wall joints that you hope always stay that way. Unbelievable food and service. We are definitely coming back.

It pains me so much to write this review because I've been a fan of this restaurant since they've opened and have been a walking advertisement for this place sending as much business there with possible. However are there's in a paradigm shift with the food here and it concerns me. 

The last 2 trips here left me a underwhelmed and disappointed. 

It seemed that the love is lost with the food.The food prep, taste and presentation was far from the standard that I've come to expect from this place. 
1.The meat topping on the dog and fries were huge clumps and tasted like a dirty burnt grill.
2. The bun was wet (not from the sauce) but from what I assume was condensation from pulling it out of the freezer. 
3. There were huge chunks of veggies on both items. rest There seemed to no love or craftsmanship with the food prep. 
4. The food prep killed this dishes I don't want to sound like I am exaggerating on this but the chunkyness of the toppings caused you to eat them separately, failing to blend the flavors properly. I'd get a mouthfull of meat on one bite and then a mouthfull of veggies on another....   

I don't want to criticize too much as I have always been fond of the food here it has missed the mark the last 2 times. 

Please take heed of the honest feedback and restore your food back to the glorious stature it once held in my heart and stomach. 

Until then, I cannot put my shiny must-eat recommendation on the food anymore..

There's already a great Asian infused burger place in Vegas. An Asian infused hot dog place would be just as great. This place has been on my radar for awhile, so I didn't hesitate trying it on my last trip.

Originally it was just hot dogs, but they've expanded their menu to include rice bowls and other things. There's a giant wall menu you can look at, just don't make it seem like you're staring at the guy eating against the wall.

Banh Mi Dog - Who would've guessed I would order the Vietnamese style dog right? It was topped with Pork Belly and the typical banh mi goodies. I added a fried egg for only 95 cents. The hot dog was big, long, and delicious. http://s3-media1.ak.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/PxZvs_y-iYK_wALRJeXmMA/l.jpg

The gf and I shared an ordered of fries. Typical fries. I'll have to try the Angry Kimchi fries next time.

If this place were in Cali, it'd be on a food truck and competing with Dogzilla.
Banh mi dog looked great, but taste was lacking. The dog itself was rubbery and bland while the topping of lightly pickled veggies was pretty good.

Amazing hot dogs, Buldogi's does some magic with weenier and bun. We tried the bulgogi dog, chili cheese dog and Kim chi fries. It's spicy food so ask for mild if you need it. I like my Korean BBQ food and Buldogi's has created a delicious hybrid with hot dogs. The sauces are rich. Unfortunately, the sauces gave me a bit of a cough for a half hour afterwards. But it's worth it. This place puts Pink's to shame. All the staff was great, nice and patient. We arrived 10 minutes before closing, not recommended, but the staff was all too happy to serve us great food. There is a soda fountain and some canned drinks in the frig. It's just a plain place inside with Buldogi memorabilia and news articles praising their dogs. But I didn't need Oprah Magazine to tell me what my tastebuds already knew; it's tasty!

There is nothing healthy about this place but it is everything Yummy! Even if you aren't a huge hot dog lover, you can still appreciate the flavors that are added to their hot dog creations from their asian fusion offerings to their interpretation of American favorites like a Philly Cheesesteak. Sauces taste fresh as well as the ingredients, and not soggy at all. I do not recommend trying to eat this in your car because you need to mimick the Guy Fiere hunch and bite to avoid a mess. Now, I just wish they had another location closer to Henderson.

Luckily we looked on yelp and found one of our old favorite hot dog places offers a vegan and vegetarian options. The hotdogs are made from soy beans which are cooked on a completely separate pan specifically for soy bean hot dogs only. I ordered the mac & cheese hotdog with homemade mac & cheese with cheddar and a herb blend. Which was amazing, seriously, couldn't t tell it wasn't a real (meat) hotdog!! And my wife ordered the vegetarian, hotdog which comes with close slaw, tomato, cheddar, green onions and honey Dijon mayo, which she said she really enjoyed. We even had to ask the waiter if he was sure that wasn't meat hot dog!!

Best hot dog I've ever had. HANDS DOWN! One thing I will say is be aware of the Dragon Kimchi dog. I enjoy spicy food and it was by far and away the spicest thing I've ever had. 

Can't wait to go again!

The hoomie from work came in with this carne fries the other day that looked bomb so I asked him where he got this place I had to have them asap . So I got here Tryed em and they are amazing!! I def can't wait to get back to this place to try all of the other interesting menu creations . Also big shoot out to the staff we where greeted with a smile bye a wonderful cashier who seemed to be very happy to be here helping people out . Also the cooks where friendly wishing warm exits to those leaving .

I have been wanting to try this place for months. The staff was so nice, I asked them what their favorites were, and one guy asked me if I like spicy, and I do, so I went with his suggestion, the Dragon Dog, it isn't on the regular menu, it was on the special board. Very good, different, and fresh. I will be back to try others.

What a great idea basic 1/4 pounder dogs.  And a semi fusion menu.  This place was a must try for me.  They have more than just the dogs as well look this place up I was thoroughly happy !!  My only critique was the chili is a bit thick and not traditional enough.  Too much fusion on the classic.

I have been slightly curious about Buldogi's over the years and when I came across an Entertainment book coupon for buy one get one free menu item free, I could no longer resist. 

I ordered the Gangnam dog which was topped with pork belly and pickled cucumber and my friend and I shared an angry kimchi fries, but switched out the sweet potato fries for regular fries. 

The service was friendly and quick and we had our food in no time. The food looked so pretty, it made for a perfect picture opportunity.

My dog was good, nothing to write home about, but it was decent and I enjoyed the toppings more than the actual hot dog since it got a little wrinkly and shriveled after the cooking process. The fries were well cooked. I have a feeling I might enjoy plain fries more if I were to come back, instead of the ones with all the toppings. The fries themselves were perfectly cooked and while I enjoyed all the toppings, including the nicely cooked egg, I found myself picking out the plain fries to enjoy by themselves.

Overall, I enjoyed our meal, but I don't think I'd make this a regular stop on my foodventures.

Great dogs. Had the Chicago Dog. Nice big dog, the hot dog snaps when you bite to it fresh ingredients. 
We also had the carne asada fries. Dang great tasting dish. All fresh ingredients and the taste of the meat the entire dish was awesome - I wish I ordered it. 
The only negative is this the fried pickle spears. Now I might be picky, but for a place that provides great tasting FRESH ingredients on the hot dogs and carne asada fries - I watched the employee take the breaded pickles out of the freezer, out of the store bought bag and place them in the fryer. Now I will say the fried pickle spears are tasty - BUT - you guys can do better - make them fresh. Make some awesome breading and put your own mark on those pickles. That said I will be back great tasting food.  
Employee that greeted us was very friendly and outgoing.  Now the place did smell a bit greasy - I'm hoping that's why the contractor was there looking at the vent hoods
Very enjoyable food.
One star deduction for the frozen fried pickle spears.
Finally went there and ordered a chili cheese dog and fries..fries were good..but the chili wasn't that good..it had too much of a sweet taste..

Best gourmet hotdog joint in Vegas..I work in the same shopping complex as this business and they are always super friendly and everything on the menu is superb. If you haven't tried or were thinking about trying them out, I ask you why haven't you gone yet!

This is a small restaurant with interesting flavors. They support the military and give military discount which was a plus for us since we are a military family. 

I ordered the beef bulgogi dog which had good flavors. Although, the condiments were piled high and a little messy I thought it had bold flavors and was interesting. 

My husband ordered the banh mi dog which he ate pretty fast so I know he enjoyed it. He also ordered us carne asada fries to share with an egg on top. 

Overall, this place was very interesting and I enjoyed their food.
